metadata.Title: CVE-2022-25375 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in drivers/usb/gadget/function/rndis.c in the Linux kernel before 5.16.10. The RNDIS USB gadget lacks validation of the size of the RNDIS_MSG_SET command. Attackers can obtain sensitive information from kernel memory. It was discovered that the Remote NDIS (RNDIS) USB gadget implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate the size of the RNDIS_MSG_SET command. An attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

notes.Note: sbeattie> fix should also include followup commit 65f3324f4b6f ("usb: gadget: rndis: prevent integer overflow in rndis_set_response()")

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
